class_f_03_dragon_01: Hello, class! It is I, Hassel, yet again.[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_02:
I’ve been told that my previous lecture about
the Terastal phenomenon was very well received.\r
Thank you all for your kind words![npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_03:
In fact, Ms. Dendra specifically requested that
I impart even more battle knowledge to\r
my students...[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_04:
So, I have decided that today we will take
another look at how a Pokémon can Terastallize![npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_05: And of course, here is Professor Gible to help us.[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_06:
Now then, Professor Gible. If you would be so
kind as to Terastallize for us...[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_07:
Now, what do we have here? Last class we saw
Grass-type Terastallizing, but this time we have\r
something of a different shape.[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_08:
Observe, a Tera Jewel resembling a snowflake!
Its dendritic shape is stunning to behold.[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_09: It’s a little chilly standing so close to it...[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_10:
So, class... What Tera Type do you imagine this
jewel might represent?[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_answer_01:

class_f_03_dragon_11:
The reason there’s a snowflake shining above
Professor Gible’s head is simple—it is now\r
an Ice type![npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_12:
And because Professor Gible is currently the
Ice type...[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_13:
Ice-type moves would not be very effective
against it. Keep in mind, usually they would\r
deal quadruple damage to Gible![npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_14:
Now, here’s some trivia about snowflakes:
while snowflakes come in many different shapes\r
and sizes, most are classified as hexagons![npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_15:
Just think of it... Snowflakes fall from the sky,
taking similar shapes without anyone saying\r
they must.[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_16:
Do you not feel the great mystery of nature?
The beautiful enigma we live in?![npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_17:
*cough*\c
Ah, this is a bit of a tangent, but Mr. Jacq’s
glasses are also hexagonal, aren’t they.[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_18:
I almost forgot to mention that you can change
a Pokémon’s Tera Type at the [clr:6]Treasure Eatery[clr:0]\r
located in Medali.[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_19:
Though I must say the cook there is a little...
prickly—you’ll need to get on her good side if\r
you want her help.[npcn:12]
class_f_03_dragon_20:
Now, come prepared for next class, because it is
time for your midterm examination!\c
Thank you for today, Professor Gible.[npcn:12]
